text: A Message Concerning Babylon
The word that Yahweh spoke concerning Babylon, concerning the land of \add the\add* Chaldeans, by the hand of Jeremiah the prophet:
“Declare among the nations and proclaim,
and lift up a banner.
Proclaim, you must not conceal \add it\add*.
Say, ‘Babylon is captured,
Bel is ashamed,
Merodach is filled with terror,
her idols are ashamed,
her idols are filled with terror.
For a nation will come up against her from \add the\add* north.
It will make her land as a horror,
and an inhabitant will not be in her.
From humans\f + \fr 50:3 \ft Hebrew “human” \f* to animals\f + \fr 50:3 \ft Hebrew “animal” \f* they \add all\add* will wander \add off\add*.
They will go \add away\add*.
In those days and in that time,’ ” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 50:4 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh,
“the people\f + \fr 50:4 \ft Or “sons/children” \f* of Israel will come,
they and the people\f + \fr 50:4 \ft Or “sons/children” \f* of Judah together.
⸤Weeping as they go⸥,\f + \fr 50:4 \ft Literally “They shall go and weeping” \f* they will go,
and Yahweh their God they will seek.
They will ask \add the\add* way \add to\add* Zion,
\add turning\add* their faces there.
They will come and join themselves to Yahweh
\add by\add* ⸤an everlasting covenant⸥\f + \fr 50:5 \ft Literally “a covenant of eternity” \f* \add that\add* will not be forgotten.
My people have become lost sheep,
their shepherds have caused them to go astray.
They led them away \add to the\add* mountains.
From mountain to hill they have gone,
they have forgotten their resting place.
All \add those who\add* found them have devoured them.
And their foes have said, ‘We are not guilty,
⸤because⸥\f + \fr 50:7 \ft Literally “under that” \f* they have sinned against Yahweh, the ⸤true pasture⸥,\f + \fr 50:7 \ft Literally “settlement of righteousness” \f*
even Yahweh, the hope of their ancestors.’\f + \fr 50:7 \ft Or “fathers” \f*
Flee from the midst of Babylon,
and from the land of \add the\add* Chaldeans.
Go out and be like he-goats
⸤before⸥\f + \fr 50:8 \ft Literally “to the face of” \f* \add the\add* flock.
For look, I \add am\add* going to stir up,
and I \add am\add* going to bring against Babylon
a contingent of great nations
from \add the\add* land of \add the\add* north.
And they will draw up a battle formation against her,
from there she will be captured.
Their arrows \add are\add* like a warrior \add who has\add* achieved success,
he does not return without success.
And Chaldea will be as booty,
all \add those who\add* plunder her will be satisfied,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 50:10 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh.
“Though you rejoice, though you exult,
O plunderers of my inheritance,
though you frisk about like a heifer on the grass,
and you neigh like the powerful stallions,
your mother will be very ashamed.
\add She who\add* gave birth \add to\add* you will be humiliated.\f + \fr 50:12 \ft Or “ashamed” \f*
Look, \add she will be the\add* least of \add the\add* nations,
a desert,\f + \fr 50:12 \ft Or “wilderness” \f* dry land, and wilderness.\f + \fr 50:12 \ft Or “Arabah” \f*
Because of the anger of Yahweh she will not be inhabited,
but she will be a wasteland, all of her.
Everyone \add who\add* passes by Babylon will be appalled
and will hiss because of all her wounds.
Draw up a battle formation at Babylon all around,
all those who bend \add the\add* bow, shoot at her.
You must not spare arrows,\f + \fr 50:14 \ft Hebrew “arrow” \f*
for she has sinned against Yahweh.
Raise a war cry against her on all sides.
⸤She has surrendered⸥.\f + \fr 50:15 \ft Literally “She has given her hand” \f*
Her towers have fallen,
her walls are ruined.
For this \add is\add* the vengeance of Yahweh.
Take revenge on her.
As she has done \add to others\add*,
\add so\add* do to her.
Cut off \add the\add* sower from Babylon,
and \add the\add* one who uses \add the\add* sickle in \add the\add* time of harvest.
⸤Because of⸥\f + \fr 50:16 \ft Literally “From the face of” \f* the sword of the oppressor
each one will turn to their people,
and each one will flee to their land.
Israel \add is\add* a sheep scattered,
lions drove \add them\add* away.
\add The\add* first who devoured it \add was\add* the king of Assyria,
and now \add at\add* the end Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon, gnawed its bones.”
⸤Therefore⸥\f + \fr 50:18 \ft Literally “To thus” \f* thus says Yahweh of hosts, the God of Israel,
“Look, I \add am\add* going to punish the king of Babylon and his land
just as I punished the king of Assyria.
And I will restore Israel to its pasture,
and it will feed \add on\add* Carmel, and \add in\add* Bashan,
and on the hills\f + \fr 50:19 \ft Hebrew “hill” \f* of Ephraim, and \add in\add* Gilead
its hunger will be satisfied.
In those days and at that time,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 50:20 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh,
“the guilt of Israel will be sought, but there \add is\add* none,
and the sins of Judah, but they will not be found,
for I will forgive those I left behind.
To the land of Merathaim,
go up against her,
and against the inhabitants of Pekod,
massacre and destroy them,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 50:21 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh,
“and do according to all that I have commanded you.
\add The\add* sound of battle \add is\add* in the land,
and great destruction.
How the blacksmith’s hammer of all the earth is cut down and broken!
How Babylon has become as a horror among the nations!
I laid a bird snare for you, and you were caught, \add O\add* Babylon.
But you yourself \add did\add* not know.
You were discovered and seized,
because with Yahweh you measured yourself.
Yahweh has opened his armory,
and he has brought out the weapons of his wrath,
for it \add is\add* a word for my Lord Yahweh of hosts
in the land of \add the\add* Chaldeans.
Come against her from \add the\add* end,
open her granaries.
Pile her up like heaps and destroy her.
Let there be no remnant for her.
Massacre all her bulls,
let them go down to the slaughtering.
Woe to them, for \add their\add* day has come,
the time of their punishment.
\add There is the\add* sound of fugitives and survivors
from the land of Babylon,
to declare in Zion the vengeance of Yahweh our God,
the vengeance for his temple.
Summon archers against Babylon,
all those who bend \add the\add* bow.
Encamp all around her,
there must not be for her an escape.
Take revenge on her according to her deeds.
According to all that she has done, \add so\add* do to her.
For against Yahweh she has behaved insolently,
against the Holy One of Israel.
⸤Therefore⸥\f + \fr 50:30 \ft Literally “To thus” \f* her young men will fall in her public squares,
and all ⸤her soldiers⸥\f + \fr 50:30 \ft Literally “her the men of war” \f* will perish on that day,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 50:30 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh.
“Look, I \add am\add* against you, \add O\add* arrogant \add one\add*,”
⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 50:31 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Lord Yahweh of hosts,
“for your day has come,
\add the\add* time \add when\add* I will punish you.
And \add the\add* arrogant \add one\add* will stumble and fall,
and there is no \add one who\add* raises \add him\add* up.
And I will kindle a fire in his cities,
and it will devour everything around him.”
Thus says Yahweh of hosts:
“The people\f + \fr 50:33 \ft Or “sons/children” \f* of Israel \add are\add* oppressed,
and the people\f + \fr 50:33 \ft Or “sons/children” \f* of Judah likewise,
⸤for⸥\f + \fr 50:33 \ft Literally “and” \f* all their captors have seized them,
they refuse to let them go free.
Their redeemer \add is\add* strong,
his name \add is\add* Yahweh of hosts.
Surely he will plead their case,
in order to make peace \add for\add* the earth,
but to cause unrest to the inhabitants of Babylon.
A sword against \add the\add* Chaldeans,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 50:35 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh,
“and against the inhabitants of Babylon,
and against her officials,
and against her wise men.
A sword against the oracle priests,
and they will become foolish.
A sword against her warriors,
and they will be filled with terror.
A sword against his horses,
and against his chariots,\f + \fr 50:37 \ft Hebrew “chariot” \f*
and against all the foreign troops who \add are\add* in the midst of her,
so that they may become as women.
A sword against her treasures,
so that they may be plundered.
A drought \add will come\add* against her waters,
and they will dry up,
for it \add is\add* a land of images,
and because of the frightful \add objects\add*, they act like madmen.

⸤Therefore⸥\f + \fr 50:39 \ft Literally “To thus” \f* desert creatures will live \add there\add*\f + \fr 50:39 \ft Here the direct object is supplied from context in the English translation \f* with jackals,
and daughters of ostriches\f + \fr 50:39 \ft Hebrew “ostrich” \f* will inhabit her.
And she will not be inhabited again ⸤forever⸥,\f + \fr 50:39 \ft Literally “to eternity” \f*
and she will not be dwelt in ⸤for all generations⸥.\f + \fr 50:39 \ft Literally “until generation and generation” \f*
As \add when\add* God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah
and their neighbors,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 50:40 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh,
“no one will live there,
and \add the\add* son of humankind will not dwell as an alien in her.
Look, a people \add is\add* about to come
from \add the\add* north,
and a great nation and many kings are woken up
from \add the\add* remotest part of \add the\add* earth.
They keep hold of bow and short sword.
They \add are\add* cruel and they have no mercy.
Their sound \add is\add* like the sea, it roars,
and upon horses they ride.
Drawn up for battle as a man for the battle,
against you, O daughter of Babylon.
The king of Babylon heard their report
and his hands grew slack.
Anxiety has seized him,
fear and pain like the \add woman who\add* gives birth.
Look, like a lion he comes up from the thickets\f + \fr 50:44 \ft Hebrew “thicket” \f* of the Jordan
against ⸤a pastureland by a constantly flowing stream⸥,\f + \fr 50:44 \ft Literally “a pasture of ever-flowing” \f*
so ⸤I will chase them away quickly⸥\f + \fr 50:44 \ft Literally “I will do in an instant I will cause them to run” \f* from her,
and I will appoint whoever \add is\add* chosen over her.
For who \add is\add* like me, and who can summon me,
and who \add is\add* this shepherd who can stand ⸤before me⸥?\f + \fr 50:44 \ft Literally “to the face of me” \f*
⸤Therefore⸥\f + \fr 50:45 \ft Literally “To thus” \f* hear the plan of Yahweh
that he has planned against Babylon,
and his plans
that he has planned against the land of \add the\add* Chaldeans.
⸤Surely⸥\f + \fr 50:45 \ft Literally “If not” \f* they will drag them away,
the little \add ones\add* of the flock.
⸤Surely⸥\f + \fr 50:45 \ft Literally “If not” \f* he will cause \add their\add* grazing place
to be desolate over them.
At \add the\add* sound, ‘Babylon has been captured,’
the earth will quake,
and a cry for help among the nations
will be heard.”
